title: Abraham and Abimelech
summary: In Genesis 20, Abraham lies to King Abimelech, saying Sarah is his sister. God warns Abimelech in a dream, and he returns Sarah untouched. Abraham prays for Abimelech, and God blesses him.

faq.question: Why did Abraham say Sarah was his sister?
faq.answer: He feared for his life, thinking the people would kill him to take her.

faq.question: How did God protect Sarah?
faq.answer: He warned Abimelech in a dream and prevented him from sinning with her.
